capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly the boy who lived, and it's amazing to think about all he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world from birth just because of your parents' deaths? It's a heavy burden to carry, but Harry rose to the challenge and became an incredible hero.

You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's like a symbol of hope for many people, especially after everything he went through as "the boy who lived". I mean, can you imagine being famous just because you're the only one to survive a killing curse? It's crazy to think about how that would affect your life.

But what really gets me is how Harry's story has inspired so many others. He's shown us that even in the darkest of times, there's always hope for a better future. And I think that's something we can all learn from.

You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's like a symbol of hope for many people, especially in the wizarding world. The fact that he was destined to be "the boy who lived" is just incredible. It's amazing how his life was forever changed after that fateful day when he survived the killing curse. I think it's really interesting how J.K. Rowling wove this narrative around him, making him a hero for so many fans.
